name: N. Goldstein
title: Partner
credentials: J.D., University of Pennsylvania Law School, 1995
M.U.P., Urban Planning, University of Pennsylvania, 1995
Licensed in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and Delaware
bio: N. Goldstein is a premier commercial real estate attorney with extensive experience in complex property transactions, zoning law, and land use planning. With unique educational credentials including degrees in architecture and urban planning, Goldstein brings a comprehensive understanding of development projects from conception through completion. As a Partner at Swartz Campbell, Goldstein represents developers, investors, and municipalities in large-scale commercial real estate transactions, including office buildings, retail centers, and mixed-use developments. The practice encompasses acquisition and disposition transactions, construction and permanent financing, ground leasing, and joint venture formations. Goldstein has particular expertise in zoning and land use matters, representing clients before planning boards and zoning hearing boards to obtain necessary approvals for development projects. With membership in the American Planning Association, Goldstein stays current with evolving planning principles and sustainable development practices. The architectural background provides valuable insight into design and construction issues that frequently arise in real estate transactions, making Goldstein an invaluable advisor to clients undertaking complex development projects.
